e4: Switching to the new policy enhances the company's credibility and integrity by eliminating biased reporting. While it may cause short-term confusion among some investors, it ultimately fosters trust and aligns with ethical standards of financial reporting. This transparency can attract more long-term investors and potentially strengthen the company's reputation in the market.
e5: An ethical reporting policy must prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness in presenting financial information. It should avoid any intentional misrepresentations or biases that could mislead stakeholders. Additionally, ethical policies should consider the understanding and context of various investor groups, ensuring that all parties have access to the true financial health of the company. Regular communication and education about reporting practices can help build trust and mitigate misunderstandings.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in reporting policy to stakeholders effectively and what strategies will be employed to address potential confusion among investors. Additionally, I would inquire about how the management anticipates the financial market may react to this change and whether there are contingency plans in place to mitigate any negative impacts.
